headline.main: South Carolina Students Repay A 134-Year-Old Act of Kindness
headline.kicker: A NATION CHALLENGED: HELP FOR NEW YORK

lead_paragraph: Students at White Knoll Middle School said today that they had raised more than $447,000 to buy a fire truck to replace one of those destroyed in the World Trade Center disaster on Sept. 11. For the children and their adult supporters, it was repaying the kindness of New York City firefighters 134 years ago.
abstract: Students at White Knoll Middle School, Columbia, SC, raise more than $447,000 to buy fire truck to replace one of those destroyed in World Trade Center disaster on September 11; are repaying kindness of New York City firefighters, who delivered hose-carriage to burning city in 1867 to help it recover from ravages of Civil War (S)
